medical_history.chief_complaint: Rapidly increasing abdominal girth and discomfort.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began five weeks prior to admission with increasing abdominal distention over several days, accompanied by rapid weight gain (from 56.7 kg to 70.3 kg), right upper abdominal discomfort, nausea, and vomiting.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Partial thyroidectomy at age 22, appendectomy and tonsillectomy during childhood. No known allergies. Patient has a history of weight loss (9.1 kg) in the six months preceding due to diet and reduced appetite from stress. No history of thrombosis and did not take oral contraceptives.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal grandmother had deep venous thromboses and intestinal cancer. Two sisters are well; one takes aspirin for clot prevention.
medical_history.social_history: Born in Egypt, emigrated to the US seven years ago. Lives with her teenage son, teaches at a university, and does not use alcohol or tobacco.
